ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I continued to practice and improve my Chinese language abilities both in class and through tutorials. I was also exposed to Chinese literature and movies and used my Chinese language skills to understand and analyze these pieces of media.
I improved my Chinese language skills and got the opportunity to apply them to reading stories and watching movies.
Movie-related vocab, continuation of advanced grammar and vocabulary

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: discussing films and stories was a very fun subject, lots of time for practicing speaking/vocab/grammar, shen laoshi is very supportive. Weaknesses: none.

I really enjoyed the movies and stories chosen for the course. While I learned a lot in the class times, I think there could have been more opportunities for student speaking practice or language games to increase engagement.

Well organized course, I appreciate the course calendar that is very clear. I wish there was more opportunity to speak and maybe some more vocabulary practice opportunities, as there is so much vocab it is quite difficult to study for the exams.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to students taking Chinese already. This class is less stressful and intensive than lower-level courses, but you still learn lots of new vocab and having many opportunities to practice your language skills.
I would recommend this course to another student. It was never too stressful because the expectations were always clear and the teachers were extremely kind.
Yes! If you are looking for a fun advanced Chinese class, this is a fun one to discuss Chinese and Taiwanese arts and culture while advancing your speaking and vocabulary skills.
